definition: face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: A charter is a mask; the lie lurks beneath it.
sentences.chinese: 憲章是個假面具，蓋在那下面的是謊話。

sentences.english: We tore from them the mask of democracy.
sentences.chinese: 我們撕下了他們民主的假面具。

sentences.english: You can drop the moonlight and magnolias , Scarlett.
sentences.chinese: 你可以撕下你的假面具了，斯佳麗。

sentences.english: It wears a golden mask, flits about in the forest.
sentences.chinese: 它戴着金色的假面，在森林裏飛來飛去。

sentences.english: Look at her, a mask of innocence. ;
sentences.chinese: 你瞧瞧她那一副天真的假面具。

sentences.english: He went masked ball without masking his face.
sentences.chinese: 他去參加化裝舞會而沒戴假面具。

sentences.english: Violence may also put on the mask of law.
sentences.chinese: 暴力也可能戴着法律的假面具。

sentences.english: The world is his, who can see through its pretension.
sentences.chinese: 這世界是他的，他看穿了它的假面。

sentences.english: Accept and heal whatever bubbles to the front. Throw away all your masks and your false faces.
sentences.chinese: 丟棄你所有的僞裝和假面。

sentences.english: He ripped away the mask of pretence which covered their activities.
sentences.chinese: 他剝掉了遮蓋他們行動的假面具。

sentences.english: But at present, In my heart, Mental Mask guardianship my soul.
sentences.chinese: 但是現在，假面在我的內心中，守護着我的靈魂。

sentences.english: So it made the vaizards true vaizards because that was Urahara's wish.
sentences.chinese: 假面之所以是真假面，正因爲浦原的願望。

sentences.english: The moon made his face into a silver mask.
sentences.chinese: 月光使他的臉像是戴上了銀色的假面具。

definition: leech/bloodsucking vermin/vampire (translated European notion)/fig. cruel exploiter, esp. a capitalist exploiting the workers
